item.title: June 12 as Democracy Day bill passes second reading - The Punch
item.description:
June 12 as Democracy Day bill passes second reading  The Punch

A Bill for an Act to amend the Public Holidays Act to declare June 12 as Democracy Day in Nigeria has passed the second ready at the House of Repre...

item.title: Bill to declare June 12 Democracy Day not political —Rep - Vanguard
item.description:
Bill to declare June 12 Democracy Day not political —Rep  Vanguard

Abuja – Rep Edward Pwajok, Chairman, House Committee on Rules and Business, says the motive behind the bill to declare June 12 as Democracy Day ...

item.title: Nigeria's Buhari says sorry for presidential election annulled 25 years ago - CNN
item.description:
Nigeria's Buhari says sorry for presidential election annulled 25 years ago  CNN

Hasfat Abiola is a democracy advocate and daughter of the Nigerian politician Moshood Kashimawo Olawale (MKO) Abiola, who was put in prison after claiming the country's 1993 presidential election. IERRE BOUSSEL/AFP/Getty Images Politician and philanthropist MKO Abiola won almost 60% of the 1993 vote. But Nigeria's ruling junta annulled the election and in 1994 arrested Abiola on a charge of treason. IERRE BOUSSEL/AFP/Getty Images MKO Abiola died in July 1998 while still in custody. STR/AFP/Getty Images Hafsat Abiola is the founder of the Kudirat Initiative for Democracy, a non-governmental ...
